alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 2:16PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Albany and southwestern Laramie Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 216 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Buford, or 19 miles southeast of Laramie, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and accumulating hail of pea to half inch size. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crystal Lake Reservoir, Granite Springs Reservoir, Crystal Lake Campground, Granite Springs Campground and Buford. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 333 and 340. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
